name: TheAtlantic
text: A decades-old legal argument once used to justify Hitler is gaining support in Beijing. @changxche explores the links between a Nazi lawyer and China’s Communists: https://t.co/7dJBVMlwob

name: TheAtlantic
text:
.@BTS_twt are the first artists to land a Korean song at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100—and they did it without the help of U.S. radio.

@lenikacruz on why the Grammy-nominated pop septet’s hit single “Life Goes On” is resonating with millions: https://t.co/9UirYTsjZG

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The past few weeks have offered a preview of what Donald Trump’s post-presidency might look like: The president fulminates at length, playing pundit, but is a practical nonfactor in policy discussions," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/ZR9YJFga60

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump’s veneer of invincibility is fading. He lost his bid for reelection, and staged the most incompetent coup attempt since Woody Allen’s 'Bananas,'" @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/O5fIBuEy4S

name: TheAtlantic
text: Rudy Giuliani has gone out of his way to do Trump's bidding, including trying to overturn the 2020 election results. But his motivations may be more about self-preservation than anything else, Peter Stone reports. https://t.co/z6Peto7MeJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The past few weeks have offered a preview of what Donald Trump’s post-presidency might look like: The president fulminates at length, playing pundit, but is a practical nonfactor in policy discussions," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/IIJQ7qvfvK

name: TheAtlantic
text: Arecibo, the giant radio observatory in Puerto Rico, has collapsed. In November @marinakoren explained why one of the world's most beloved telescopes was coming to an unexpected, catastrophic end: https://t.co/FtprDyh8hL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Rudy Giuliani has gone out of his way to do Trump's bidding, including trying to overturn the 2020 election results. But his motivations may be more about self-preservation than anything else, Peter Stone reports. https://t.co/wBRqoqFvQI

name: TheAtlantic
text: Looking at sparkly pictures from the Hubble space telescope might make some of us feel small—but that can be a good thing, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/KRsTN2XFwc

name: TheAtlantic
text: HBO could have highlighted the brutal reality of intimate-partner violence in ‘The Undoing.’ Instead, the show tries to seduce viewers with murder, @eveagerber writes: https://t.co/E9DEieybSU

name: TheAtlantic
text: When it comes to pandemic safety, Americans are still not on the same page. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/r6HcD5I7ew

name: TheAtlantic
text: The first two COVID-19 vaccine trials went pretty much perfectly. AstraZeneca's did not. Here's what to expect from forthcoming vaccine trials, from @sarahzhang: https://t.co/Og8TlWQRZc

name: TheAtlantic
text: Our understanding of COVID-19 vaccines is sharpening up, but we still don’t have all the answers. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/XxQtD2zALN

name: TheAtlantic
text: For four years, North Carolina has prohibited towns and cities from passing new protections for LGBTQ people. Today, that ban expires. But what comes next is uncertain, @giuliaheyward reports: https://t.co/r9Tj9FR7st

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Trump attention vortex isn’t what it used to be. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/D4N6J8QmSL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/ZY4adCYUKG

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Just as Donald Trump’s claims of fraud have proved to be a self-soothing delusion, moderates’ attacks on progressives are untethered from the reality of increasing support for progressive policies," @DrIbram writes: https://t.co/HHqBsEpSwF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Wednesday's record-breaking coronavirus numbers make it clear: Pandemic winter is here, writes @whet. https://t.co/SvBSZUSoj8

name: TheAtlantic
text:
1/ In March @edyong209 wrote about how a “rudderless, blindsided, lethargic, and uncoordinated” response could leave the U.S. with the worst COVID-19 outbreak in the industrialized world.

His story was @Pocket’s most read of 2020. https://t.co/azDvnmPDY9

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2/ Also topping the @Pocket list is @jameshamblin on how Americans have finally developed good hand-washing habits, but all our other scrubbing and grooming may do more harm than good. https://t.co/Jsighxkesu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
3/3 Finally, read @rhainacohen’s piece about the people who made a friend their primary life partner, which was @Pocket’s second most read culture story:

“These friendships have many of the trappings of romantic relationships, minus the sex,” she wrote. https://t.co/KbOYh8wtfB

name: TheAtlantic
text: When it comes to happiness, are you a Mad Scientist, a Cheerleader, a Sober Judge, or a Poet? The "How to Build a Life" columnist @arthurbrooks is a Mad Scientist—he feels high levels of both positive and negative emotions: https://t.co/lvPxLvYLYF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Miley Cyrus’s latest rebellion isn’t in the sound of her ’70s-influenced rock album, “Plastic Hearts.” It’s in her message about monogamy, @skornhaber writes: https://t.co/bH67qTfbtX

name: TheAtlantic
text: Doctors predict that Iowa's lax response to the pandemic will result in a “super peak” over the holidays—and thousands of preventable deaths in the weeks to come, @elainejgodfrey reports: https://t.co/ndXl9UmdO6
